moves.1. d4 d5 2. Nc3: this is a mirror of the most popular opening today. 1e4...2Nf3 are probably the most common moves to start a game
moves.2... c6: You almost never see this, though I don't know why. it's not a BAD move, it's just not all that good. the only downside is Nc6 is no longer a playable move
moves.3... Qd6: This is the beginning of blacks kingside attack. He sees the potential super castle with Bg2, Nf3.
moves.4. Bg2: I play along with black for awhile.
moves.4... Nf6: Ng4 is an amazing spot for black in a kingside attack, because it is almost always unguarded.
moves.5. Nf3 Ng4: this is where the game gets fun.
moves.7. Bg5: continuing my queen attack. that knight is very useful on f3.
moves.7... Qf5 8. Bh3 h5 9. Qd2 f6 10. e4 dxe4: ok. have you ever had one of those moments where you stop and think "How the HECK did that happen?!"
moves.11... Qe6 12. d5: the queen is getting more and more caged in every second.
moves.12... Qe5 13. Bf4: The queen has nowhere to run, so the only hope is to counter-attack, which is hard to do when your as underdeveloped as black is.
moves.13... e3 14. fxe3 Qf5:
how could I miss this?!?!
don't say it. I missed it, life goes on. 
Just.... don't say it.
moves.16... Rh7 17. O-O-O:
all that buildup for a kingside attack and I castle queen-side offensively
If I wasn't me I wouldn't like me very much.
moves.17... e5: it was tempting to take on that side with en passent, but I like dxc6 better.
moves.18. dxc6 Qxc6 19. Qd8+: the first check of the game. that's pretty sad
moves.19... Kf7 20. Qxf8+ Kxg6 21. Nd5 Nf2: a fork? oh no, oh, wait. never mind, carry on.
moves.22. Ne7#:
this is one of the most cramped games I've played in awhile on white. and definitly the one of the better checkmates. 
questions/comments?
